entries: When anything other than the twisting hate deals damage to the infected creature, the twisting hate takes half the damage dealt to the infected creature, and the infected creature takes the other half (before damage resistances and immunities are applied).

trait.name: Fleshwarping
entries: When an infected creature takes damage, its flesh melts and warps, causing extreme pain. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 10 plus half the damage dealt (rounded down). On a failure, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced to its current hit points. This effect lasts until the creature is no longer infected.

trait.name: Sentient Disease
entries: The twisting hate is a microscopic, sentient disease. It cannot be targeted and can only be harmed when infecting a creature. While not within a host, the twisting hate can infect any flesh-and-blood creature that comes within 30 feet of it. If the host dies, the twisting hate can infect a new creature. Creatures immune to disease can still be infected by it but have advantage on saving throws against it. If an infected creature is affected by a spell or effect that would remove a disease, the twisting hate remains in the creature but loses 25 hit points. It may only infect a single creature at a time, and when the ooze is slain, the infected creature is cured of the disease.

Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, an infected creature can attempt a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a success, the twisting hate leaves the infected creature and infects a new flesh-and-blood creature within 30 feet. If there are no uninfected flesh-and-blood creatures within 30 feet, it remains in its host but loses 25 hit points.

action.name: Acid Vomit {@recharge 5}
entries: The twisting hate forces the creature it is infecting to vomit a 30-foot-long line of acid that is 5 feet wide in a direction of the twisting hate's choice. Creatures in the line must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) acid damage, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Delirium
entries: The creature the twisting hate is infecting must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to take actions until the end of its next turn. Instead, the twisting hate can force the creature to use its action to make a single weapon attack or move according to the twisting hate's desires.

action.name: Toxic Shock
entries: The creature the twisting hate is infecting takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: When anything other than the death wrack deals damage to the infected creature, the death wrack takes half the damage dealt to the infected creature, and the infected creature takes the other half (before damage resistances and immunities are applied).

trait.name: Hidden Malady
entries: The death wrack's effects occur inside the body of an infected creature and are {@condition invisible}. As an action, a creature can attempt a {@dc 19} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) ability check, detecting the death wrack on a success. Unless discovered in this manner or until it attacks, the death wrack is considered hidden while infecting a creature.

trait.name: Sentient Disease
entries: The death wrack is a microscopic, sentient disease. It cannot be targeted and can only be harmed when infecting a creature. While not within a host, the death wrack can infect any flesh-and-blood creature that comes within 60 feet of it. If the host dies, the death wrack can infect a new creature. Creatures immune to disease can still be infected by it but have advantage on saving throws against it. If an infected creature is affected by a spell or effect that would remove a disease, the death wrack remains in the creature but loses 30 hit points. It may only infect a single creature at a time, and when the ooze is slain, the infected creature is cured of the disease.

Additionally, if the death wrack is not hidden, at the start of each of its turns an infected creature aware of the disease can attempt a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a success, the death wrack leaves the infected creature and infects a new flesh-and-blood creature within 60 feet. If there are no uninfected flesh-and-blood creatures within 60 feet, the death wrack remains in its host but loses 30 hit points.

action.name: Festering Corruption
entries: When the death wrack next deals damage, it deals an additional 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage. If it uses this ability again, the extra damage increases by an additional 22 ({@dice 5d8}), to a maximum of an extra 135 ({@damage 30d8}) necrotic damage. Once the death wrack deals damage or changes hosts, this extra damage is lost.

action.name: Healing Suppression
entries: Until the end of the infected creature's next turn, it cannot regain hit points.

action.name: Wrack
entries: The death wrack corrodes the organs of the creature it is infecting. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 5d10}) acid damage. If the creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it instead takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) acid damage.

trait.name: Brain Damage
entries: A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the mind warper has its brain permanently damaged: the target's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores become 1 and the creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way.
This effect can only be ended by a {@spell greater restoration}, {@spell heal}, or {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: When anything other than the mind warper deals damage to the infected creature, the mind warper takes half the damage dealt to the infected creature, and the infected creature takes the other half (before damage resistances and immunities are applied).

trait.name: Sentient Disease
entries: The mind warper is a microscopic, sentient disease. It cannot be targeted and can only be harmed when infecting a creature. While not within a host, the mind warper can infect any creature with an Intelligence of 4 or higher that comes within 90 feet of it. If the host is reduced to 0 hit points, the mind warper can infect a new creature in this manner. Creatures immune to disease can still be infected by the mind warper but have advantage on saving throws against it. If an infected creature is affected by a spell or effect that would remove a disease, the mind warper remains in the creature but loses 35 hit points. It may only infect a single creature at a time, and when the ooze is slain, the infected creature is cured of the disease.

Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, an infected creature can attempt a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the mind warper leaves the infected creature and infects a new creature with an Intelligence of 4 or higher within 90 feet. If there are no such creatures in range, the mind warper remains in its host but loses 35 hit points.

trait.name: Vulnerable Psyche
entries: When an infected creature takes damage other than psychic damage, it takes additional psychic damage equal to the damage taken. This additional damage is not split with the mind warper via the Damage Transfer feature.

action.name: Mind Spike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Possession {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind warper forces the creature it is infecting to attempt a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become possessed by the ooze. The target becomes {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body, and the mind warper controls the body without depriving the target of awareness.
The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the mind warper ends the possession as a bonus action, or the mind warper no longer infects the creature.

action.name: Psychic Scream (1/Short Rest)
entries: The mind warper unleashes a psychic wave of agony in a 60-foot radius centered on the creature it is infecting. Each creature other than the infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

monster.name: Soul Rot
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: When anything other than the soul rot deals damage to the infected creature, the soul rot takes half the damage dealt to the infected creature, and the infected creature takes the other half (before damage resistances and immunities are applied).

trait.name: Sentient Disease
entries: The soul rot is a microscopic, sentient disease. It cannot be targeted and can only be harmed when infecting a creature. While not within a host, the soul rot can infect any creature with a soul that comes within 120 feet of it. If the host is reduced to 0 hit points, the soul rot can infect a new creature. Creatures immune to disease can still be infected by soul rot but have advantage on saving throws against it. If an infected creature is affected by a spell or effect that would remove a disease, the soul rot remains in the creature but loses 40 hit points. It may only infect a single creature at a time, and when the ooze is slain, the infected creature is cured of the disease.

Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, an infected creature can attempt a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw. On a success, the soul rot leaves the infected creature and infects a new creature with a soul within 120 feet. If there are no uninfected creatures with a soul within 120 feet of the soul rot, it remains in its host but loses 40 hit points.

trait.name: Vile Husk
entries: A creature reduced to 0 hit points while infected by the soul rot dies instantly as its soul decays. A creature killed in this way can only be restored to life by {@spell true resurrection} or more powerful magic. However, the body of the creature lives on as a husk. Its creature type changes to undead, its alignment changes to chaotic evil, it becomes immune to necrotic damage, and it regains all its hit points. The husk is a hateful echo of the original creature, with no other purpose than to kill and destroy. When this effect occurs, the soul rot may immediately infect a creature with a soul within 120 feet. If there are no creatures with a soul to infect, the soul rot remains within the husk but can take no actions until a creature eligible for infection comes within range.

trait.name: Vulnerability
entries: A creature infected by the soul rot is vulnerable to all damage. A creature that has resistance to any types of damage loses those resistances but does not become vulnerable to that damage type. Immunities to damage are retained. Additionally, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks and cannot gain advantage.

action.name: Contaminate
entries: At the start of the infected creature's next turn, all uninfected creatures within 30 feet of it take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dormancy
entries: The soul rot enters a period of dormancy for 1 year. During this time, it cannot affect other creatures or take actions. If the soul rot is infecting a creature, it is undetectable unless a creature succeeds on a {@dc 23} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) ability check. If the soul rot takes damage, it can choose to immediately end its dormancy.

action.name: Feed
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature infected by the maleophage. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) necrotic damage, and the soul rot regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

action.name: Mitosis (Recharge 1 Year)
entries: The soul rot loses half its current hit points and splits into two new oozes. Each new ooze has hit points equal to half the original ooze's rounded down, but both have the same hit point maximum as the original ooze. One of the new oozes remains in the current host; the other one emerges from the host and can infect a new creature.

monster.name: Gallium Goo
senses: metalsense 120 ft. (see traits) (blind beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The goo can move through a space as narrow as half an inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Diffusing Touch
entries: When the goo touches a metal object or one that contains a significant quantity of metal, it can choose to lose 15 hit points to break the object, making it brittle and unstable. Affected magical objects instead lose half their maximum hit points.

trait.name: Metalsense
entries: The goo can perceive any metal within 120 ft. through its sense of smell.

trait.name: Spell Resistance
entries: The goo has resistance to damage from spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goo makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the goo may grapple it (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Regenerate
entries: The goo regains 26 ({@dice 4d10 + 4}) hit points.

action.name: Slingshot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. When the goo makes this attack, it launches its entire body at the target, landing in the nearest unoccupied space to the target.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as half an inch wide without squeezing. Additionally, other creatures can enter the ooze's space, which is considered difficult terrain.

trait.name: Deflection
entries: Attacks made against the ooze with weapons that contain metal or that fire ammunition containing metal (such as bolts or arrows) are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Magnetic Fluid
entries: The ooze's body is magnetic. Whenever the ooze comes within 10 ft. of a metal object of Medium size or smaller for the first time on its turn or starts its turn within 10 ft. of such an object, it is drawn into the ooze's body, becoming a part of its form and moving with the ooze as it moves. Objects being securely worn (such as armor) are immune to this effect, but more loosely secured items such as rings or necklaces are not. If the object is being carried or held, its wielder may attempt a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw to hold onto the object and prevent it from being drawn in. An object held within the ooze's body can be removed by a creature taking an action to attempt a {@dc 19} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) ability check, removing the object on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ooze makes two attacks and takes one other action.

action.name: Ferrokinesis
entries: The ooze telekinetically moves a metal object of Huge size or smaller up to 90 ft. If the object ends this movement in the air, the ooze can suspend it there for as long as the object remains within 90 ft. of it. A creature attempting to physically move the target must take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) ability check contested by the oozes Strength ({@skill Athletics}) ability check, or the attempt fails.
If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, it moves with the object unless it removes the object from its person.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} as it is injected with a portion of the ooze's metallic body. The fluid of the ooze can be removed by a creature taking an action to attempt a {@dc 19} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) ability check, ending the condition on a success.

action.name: Reverse Polarity
entries: The ooze reverses the magnet charge in its body. Until the end of its next turn, metal objects within range of its Magnetic Fluid feature that would be drawn toward the ooze are instead pushed away from the ooze to the outside of the area. Additionally, attacks made with metallic weapons or ammunition against the ooze are made at disadvantage.

action.name: Magnetic Pulse {@recharge 5}
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the range of the ooze's magnetic fluid feature increases from 10 ft. to 60 ft.

action.name: Recall Fluid
entries: A creature within 90 ft. {@condition poisoned} by the ooze's Pseudopod feature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition ends.

monster.name: Slag Slime
senses: thermalsense (see traits) 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Other creatures can enter the slime's space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the slime's Molten Slag feature immediately, and again at the end of each of its turns for as long as it remains within the slime's space.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: When the slime fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Melt Magic
entries: The slime is so hot that it melts magic itself. The duration of spells and magical effects with a duration greater than instantaneous affecting only the slime have their durations reduced to 1 round.

trait.name: Molten Slag
entries: At the start of each of the slime's turns, everything within 15 ft. of it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, standing water evaporates, and flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the slime or hits it with a melee attack while within 15 ft. of it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

Additionally, if the slime reduces an object or structure made of metal or stone to zero hit points, it completely melts it, leaving a pool of molten slag in its space. This slag is considered difficult terrain and deals 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage to anything that enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there. After 1 hour, slag produced by this feature cools becoming harmless but remaining difficult terrain.

trait.name: Thermalsense
entries: The slime can detect creatures within 120 ft. of it that are colder than the slime. Such creatures cannot be hidden from the slime.

trait.name: Volcanic Tunneler
entries: The slime can move through solid objects as though they were difficult terrain using its burrow speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slime makes two attacks and takes one other action.

action.name: Harden (1/short or long rest)
entries: The slime rapidly cools its body, transforming its body into solid metal. While in this state, the slime is {@condition incapacitated}, has resistance to all damage, its Molten Slag feature is suppressed, it cannot be critically hit, and regains 30 hit points at the start of each of its turns. The slime can choose to end this effect at the end of each of its turns, or until 24 hours as passed. Once the slime has used this feature, it cannot use it again until it finishes a short or long rest.

Creatures engulfed by the slime when it uses this action may attempt a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. On a success, the creature escapes from the ooze and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze. On a failure, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} in addition to the other effects of being engulfed.

action.name: Envelop
entries: The slime attempts to engulf a single creature or object completely in its space, forcing the creature to succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, or become engulfed. On a successful saving throw, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the ooze. A creature that chooses not to be pushed is engulfed. On a failed saving throw, the creature is engulfed.
While engulfed, the creature is {@condition restrained}, cannot breathe, and has total cover against creatures other than the slime. If the slime moves, an engulfed target moves with the slime.

A creature enveloped by the slime can try to escape by taking an action to attempt a {@dc 21} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze.

action.name: Expansion (3/short or long rest)
entries: Until the slime finishes a short or long rest, it increases its dimensions by 5 ft. in every direction.

action.name: Hurl Slag
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 7}) piercing and 10 ({@dice 3d6}) fire.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature, the slime may grapple it (Escape {@dc 21}).

legendaryHeader: The slime can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The slime regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Expansion (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The slime takes its Expansion action.

legendary.name: Squelch
entries: The slime moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The slime makes a single attack.

trait.name: Foundations of the Lesser
entries: The river-blessed is a member of one of the following castes, granting it the following traits and actions according to which animal head it possesses.

items.name: Crocodile - We Are Builders (1/Short or Long Rest)
items.entry: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the river-blessed can cast {@spell wall of stone}. The river-blessed automatically succeeds on saving throws to maintain concentration on the effect. Once it has used this ability, it must finish a short or long rest before it can do so again.

items.name: Feline - Sleight of Paw
entries: The river-blessed can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

Additionally, once per turn, when the river-blessed hits a creature with a melee attack, it can attempt to steal one item, object, or weapon worn or carried by the target. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or have the item taken by the river-blessed. A creature can atetmpt to recover a stolen item as an action by attempting a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check against the river-blessed's Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}). If the target wins, the item is returned.

items.name: Hippo - Waters-of-Life
items.entry: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the river-blessed can conjure healing waters that wash over it or one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target regains 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points, and if the target is {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition stunned}, those conditions immediately end.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The river-blessed makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and until the end of the river-blessed's next turn, attacks against the target have advantage.

action.name: Hydro Jet
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 6d10 + 5}) magical bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature concentrating on an effect, it has disadvantage on any saving throws it attempts to maintain concentration in response to damage dealt by this attack.

action.name: Summon the Flood {@recharge 5}
entries: The river-blessed calls upon the blessings of the river to unleash a flood of magical energies. The exact effect is dependent on the river-blessed's caste (see the Foundations of the Lesser trait).

items.name: Crocodile - Crushing Depths
items.entry: The river-blessed chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and dashes it against the ground with a barrage of water. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take magical bludgeoning damage equal to the amount prevented by Warding of the River and be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. A successful saving throw halves the damage and the target is instead {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. After using this ability, the damage prevented by Warding of the River resets to 0.

items.name: Feline - Mud of the Delta
items.entry: The river-blessed brings forth a wave of dark, muddled water at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The wave crashes down on all creatures within a 20-foot radius of that point, forcing them to succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or take magical bludgeoning damage equal to half of the amount of the river-blessed has prevented with Warding of the River and become {@condition restrained} until the end of their next turn. A successful saving throw halves the damage and prevents the {@condition restrained} condition. Once the river-blessed uses this ability, the damage prevented by Warding of the River resets to 0.

items.name: Hippo - Shielding Shallows
items.entry: The river-blessed and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it are wreathed in magical, protective water. Each target gains temporary hit points equal to half of the damage prevented by Warding of the River. After using this ability, the damage prevented by Warding of the River resets to 0.

reaction.name: Warding of the River
entries: As a reaction when a creature the river-blessed can see within 30 feet of it takes damage, the river-blessed can extend a protective ward, causing the creature to take no damage instead. Record the amount of damage prevented in this way as a cumulative total. Unless expended, 10 minutes after the last time the river-blessed used this ability, this total resets to 0.

trait.name: Ambitions of the Greater
entries: The sun-cursed is a member of one of the following castes, granting it the following traits and actions according to which animal head it possesses.

items.name: Ibis - Challenge of Minds
items.entry: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the sun-cursed can initiate a challenge of intellect with a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The sun-cursed and the target attempt opposed Intelligence ability checks. If the sun-cursed wins, until the end of its next turn the target automatically fails its next saving throw against one of the sun-cursed's abilities.

items.name: Jackal - Sunlight Burns Impurities
items.entry: The sun-cursed and all allies within 30 feet of it have resistance to damage from spells and gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to the sun-cursed's Charisma modifier.

items.name: Ram - Unsurpassed Warrior
items.entry: The sun-cursed wields a powerful halberd, and its weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Stubborn Warrior (Ram Only)
entries: If the sun-cursed would attempt a saving throw at the end of its turn to end an effect, it instead attempts that saving throw at the start of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Arcane Spellcasting (Ibis Only)
headerEntries: The sun-cursed's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Divine Spellcasting (Jackal Only)
headerEntries: The sun-cursed's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sun-cursed makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd (Ram Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage, and the target is pushed up to 10 feet away from the sun-cursed.

action.name: Leap (Ram Only)
entries: The sun-cursed moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a single Halberd attack before, after, or during this movement.

action.name: Solar Inferno (Jackal Only) {@recharge}
entries: The sun-cursed chooses a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Creatures of its choice within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) fire damage and gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. A successful saving throw halves the damage and the creatures gains only one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

reaction.name: Brutal Guardian (Ram Only)
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 10 feet of the sun-cursed makes an attack that targets a creature other than the sun-cursed, the sun-cursed can make a single Halberd attack against the attacker. On a hit, the attack deals maximum damage, the push distance is increased to 20 feet, and the sun-cursed regains the use of its reaction at the end of that turn.

reaction.name: Scorching Counterspell (Ibis Only)
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 60 feet of the sun-cursed that it can see casts a spell, the sun-cursed blasts the magic apart with burning radiance. If the creature is casting a spell of 5th level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is 6th level or higher, the sun-cursed attempts an Intelligence ability check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. Whether this ability causes the spell to fail or not, the creature casting the spell takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Born of Flames
entries: Creatures cannot be resistant to fire damage dealt by the pyromancer, and the pyromancer is immune to damage it would deal to itself.

trait.name: Motes of Netherplasm
entries: Several of the ebon pyromancer's abilities cause a mote of netherplasm to attach to a creature. An attached mote lasts until removed. When a creature starts its turn, it can choose to lose 20 hit points to remove a single mote of netherplasm attached to it. Casting {@spell greater restoration} or more powerful magic removes all motes attached to the target. Motes have the following effects depending on the number attached to a creature, and the effects are cumulative.

items.entry: {@b 1} - The creature cannot have resistance or immunty to necrotic damage.
{@b 2} - The creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the ebon pyromancer.
{@b 3} - The creature becomes vulnerable to necrotic damage, and the ebon pyromancer has resistance to all damage from the creature.
{@b 4+} - The creature automatically fails saving throws against the ebon pyromancer, and the ebon pyromancer automatically succeeds on saving throws against the creature.

trait.name: Netherplasm Residue
entries: When the ebon pyromancer starts its turn, creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and have a mote of netherplasm attach to it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ebon pyromancer makes two Cloying Death attacks and uses All Shall Burn or Spread the Plague.

action.name: All Shall Burn {@recharge 5}
entries: The ebon pyromancer designates six points it can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 10-foot cube of dark flames centered on each point. The flames are opaque, and the area within is heavily obscured to all creatures other than the ebon pyromancer. Creatures that enter the area for the first time on a turn or start their turn there take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage. At the end of the ebon pyromancer's next turn, the flames detonate. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) fire damage and a mote of netherplasm attaches to it. A successful saving throw halves the damage.

action.name: Cloying Death
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage, and a mote of netherplasm attaches to the target.

action.name: Necrotizing Fireclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) fire damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage, and a mote of netherplasm attaches to the target.

action.name: Spread the Plague
entries: The ebon pyromancer chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it that has at least one mote of netherplasm attached to it. Each other creature of the ebon pyromancer's choice within 15 feet of the target has a mote of netherplasm attached to it.

action.name: Violent Detonation
entries: All motes of netherplasm attached to creatures by the pyromancer erupt in necrotic energy. Each creature with at least one mote attached to it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage per mote of netherplasm attached to it and suffer an additional effect based on how many motes were attached before detonation.

items.entry: {@b 1} - No additional effect.
{@b 2} - The creature can take an action or bonus action on its next turn, but not both.
{@b 3} - The creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.
{@b 4+} - The creature is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

entries: A successful saving throw halves the damage, and the creature suffers an additional effect as though it had one fewer mote attached, down to a minimum of 1. Any motes of netherplasm attached to affected creatures are destroyed at the end of pyromancer's turn.

trait.name: Impossible Odds (1/Round)
entries: When the ahd moar would be affected by a spell, attack, or other ability, it can choose to be immune to the effect until the end of its next turn. For this to occur, a seemingly random event happens that gets in the way, such as a spellcaster sneezing, a coconut falling out of a clear sky on an attacker's head, or a sudden emergence of gophers.

trait.name: Luck Warping
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the ahd moar chooses to bend luck to favor itself or vex its enemies. It activates either Curse of Misfortune or Gift of Luck, causing the listed effect until the start of the ahd moar's next turn.

items.name: Curse of Misfortune
items.entry: When any creature within 120 feet of the ahd moar rolls a {@dice d20}, it instead always rolls a 5.

items.name: Gift of Luck
items.entry: When the ahd moar would roll a {@dice d20}, it instead always rolls a 15.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ahd moar takes two actions, at least one of which must be from the following options.

action.name: Fated Healing
entries: The ahd moar regains 38 ({@dice 3d20 + 7}) hit points.

action.name: Fated Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 3d20 + 7}) force damage. If the target is concentrating on a spell, it must roll a {@dice d20}. If it rolls an 11 or higher, it maintains concentration on the spell. Otherwise, the spell ends immediately.

action.name: Unlucky Hex
entries: Two creatures the ahd moar can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. While cursed in this way, when the creature deals damage, it uses the minimum possible result on all damage dice and cannot reroll any of the dice. Affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. The curse can also be broken via {@spell remove curse} or more powerful magic.

reaction.name: Alter Reality
entries: The ahd moar has three fated outcomes, each of which begins as 10. As a reaction when the ahd moar or a creature it is aware of rolls a {@dice d20}, the ahd moar can swap the number rolled with one of its fated outcomes. It then records the original result of the roll, which becomes a new fated outcome that can be used with this feature. All fated outcomes reset to 10 when the ahd moar finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Adjust Time
entries: At the beginning of each round, the tasey-am rolls for initiative and replaces its current initiative count with the new result. It may instead choose a single creature in the initiative count and force that creature to reroll its initiative and replace its current initiative count with the new result.

trait.name: Always Ready
entries: The tasey-am cannot be surprised, and attacks made against it cannot have advantage.

trait.name: Reset (1/Day)
entries: When the tasey-am is reduced to 0 hit points it vanishes until the start of the next round. At that point, it reappears in a location of its choice within 120 feet of where it disappeared, recovers all of its missing hit points, and regains any spent uses of Draw Out.

trait.name: Temporal Acceleration
entries: At the start of the tasey-am's turn, any magical effects within 5 feet of it with a duration immediately end.

trait.name: Time Traveler
entries: When the tasey-am finishes a long rest, it can choose to travel forward or backward in time, appearing in the same location up to 100 years in the future or past (specific time determined by the tasey-am).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tasey-am uses Temporal Discorporation and can then use either Temporal Discorporation again, Send Forward, or Draw Out.

action.name: Draw Out (2/Short or Long Rest)
entries: The tasey-am chooses a spell that is affecting itself or a creature it can see, ending the spell immediately. When the spell ends, the caster must attempt a {@dc 22} saving throw using its spellcasting ability, gaining on level of {@condition exhaustion} per spell level of the ended spell on a failure, or half as many levels (rounded down) on a success.

action.name: Send Forward
entries: The tasey-am sends itself or a creature it can see forward in time {@dice 1d4} rounds. The time shift doesn't take effect until the start of the next round, at which point the target disappears and is removed from initiative order. After the rolled number of rounds have elapsed, the target reappears, rolling for initiative and appearing in the space it left or the closest unoccupied space at the beginning of that round. The target may then immediately take a number of consecutive turns equal to the number of rounds it was sent forward, gaining one level of {@condition exhaustion} for each turn taken in this manner at the end of its last turn. If tasey-am targets itself with this feature, it cannot do so again until it finishes a short rest.

action.name: Temporal Discorporation
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}The target must attempt a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is teleported up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space the tasey-am can see, gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and immediately expends half of its remaining Hit Dice (rounded up), rolling them and losing that many hit points. A creature with 0 Hit Dice remaining drops to 0 hit points and begins dying. On a success, the creature is not teleported and instead rolls one-quarter of its remaining Hit Dice (rounded up) and loses that many hit points.

reaction.name: Stitches in Time
entries: As a reaction when the tasey-am is targeted by an attack or spell, it can immediately switch locations with a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, forcing the caster to target that creature instead. This is not a teleportation effect—time is rewritten, and the creature has always been there. The creature attempting to target the tasey-am can use its reaction to attempt a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw to swap and target the tasey-am if it is within range, or intentionally miss the attack or spell if not.

monster.name: Ancient Faerie Dragon

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Prismatic Coat
entries: At the start of each of the dragon's turns, roll a {@dice d6} and compare the result to the following list. The dragon's scales and feathers adopt the indicated color, and it gains the corresponding benefits which last until the start of the dragon's next turn.

items: {@b 1 - Red} - The dragon becomes immune to fire damage, and its attacks deal maximum damage to targets wearing medium armor.
{@b 2 - Orange} - The dragon becomes immune to thunder damage, and its breath weapon deals maximum damage.
{@b 3 - Yellow} - The dragon becomes immune to lightning damage, and its attacks deal maximum damage to targets wearing heavy armor.
{@b 4 - Green} - The dragon becomes immune to acid damage, and its attacks deal maximum damage to targets wearing light armor.
{@b 5 - Blue} - The dragon becomes immune to cold damage, and its attacks deal maximum damage to targets wearing no armor.
{@b 6 - Violet} - The dragon gains resistance to all damage, and it can take a second action on its turn.

trait.name: Seeing Double
entries: When the dragon rolls for initiative, it creates an illusory duplicate in an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it, and then both the dragon and its duplicate can teleport up to 60 feet to unoccupied spaces the dragon can see. When the dragon attacks or uses its Breath Weapon, it can choose to have the ability originate from its true location or the illusion's location, and characters moving away from the illusion provoke opportunity attacks as normal. When the dragon moves, the illusion moves an equivalent distance as directed by the dragon. Both the dragon and its illusion react identically when either one is attacked, giving no clues as to which is genuine.

The illusory duplicate is indistinguishable from the real dragon even to creatures with {@sense truesight}. The only way to tell them apart for certain is for a creature that can see the dragon or the duplicate to use an action for a bonus action to attempt a {@dc 24} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) ability check. On a success, the character identifies which one is an illusion and retains this knowledge for as long as at least one of the dragons can be seen. Characters with {@sense truesight} have advantage on this check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes Horn Slam attack, two Chromatic Claw attacks, and one Tail Whip attack. If available, it can replace its Horn Slam attack with its Breath Weapon.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales a 60-foot-long cone of mind-melting energy. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw or take 66 ({@damage 12d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition charmed} by the dragon. While {@condition charmed} in this manner, a creature must take an action on each of its turns to grapple the nearest ally other than the dragon. If it is already grappling an ally, the creature instead does everything in its power to maintain the grapple.

action.name: Chromatic Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) magical slashing damage, and the target must immediately expend two spell slots of its choice (if available).

action.name: Horn Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) magical bludgeoning damage, and the target is teleported up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of the dragon's choice.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) magical bludgeoning damage, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}), and the dragon learns a single secret the creature knows that it has shared with no one (when applicable). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target is {@condition restrained} and the dragon cannot Tail Whip another target.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Dazzling Chroma
entries: All creatures within 10 feet of the dragon or its illusion must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Phase Shift (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon and its illusory double teleport up to 60 feet to unoccupied spaces the dragon can see.

legendary.name: Swipe
entries: The dragon makes a Chromatic Claw attack.

trait.name: Titanic Creature
entries: The thunderking is a Titanic creature which is so large that combat involves dividing its body up into various sections, each of which has a fixed initiative count on which it acts (losing initiative ties), detailed in its description. Each section is considered a unique creature for purposes of targeting (in case an effect or attack would include multiple targets), and effects that include an area may affect multiple sections of the thunderking if the area is large enough. Each section has its own hit points and actions but shares the thunderking's other statistics (such as damage resistances), saving throws, etc.). When a section is reduced to 0 hit points, it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it regains hit points or the thunderking is slain, which causes the section to die along with the thunderking. If a section has a speed, the thunderking can move up to that section's speed during the section's turn. Creatures can enter and occupy the same space as the thunderking, which is considered difficult terrain, and the thunderking cannot make opportunity attacks. Finally, attempts to forcibly move, banish, or magically teleport the thunderking or any of its parts automatically fail.

trait.name: Purging Flames
entries: If a creature would be immune to fire damage dealt by the ashcaller, it instead has resistance to the damage.

trait.name: Titanic Creature
entries: The ashcaller is a titanic creature which is so large that combat involves dividing its body up into various sections, each of which has a fixed initiative count on which it acts (losing initiative ties), detailed in its description. Each section is considered a unique creature for purposes of targeting (in case an effect or attack would include multiple targets), and effects that include an area may affect multiple sections of the ashcaller if the area is large enough. Each section has its own hit points and actions but shares the ashcaller's other statistics (such as damage resistances, saving throws, etc.). When a section is reduced to 0 hit points, it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it regains hit points or the ashcaller is slain, which causes the section to die along with the ashcaller. If a section has a speed, the ashcaller can move up to that section's speed during the section's turn. Creatures can enter and occupy the same space as the ashcaller, which is considered difficult terrain, and the ashcaller cannot make opportunity attacks. Finally, attempts to forcibly move, banish, or magically teleport the ashcaller or any of its parts automatically fail.

trait.name: Bringer of Destruction
entries: The worldbreaker's attacks are magical. When the worldbreaker scores a hit, it deals an extra 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage (included in the attack). If a target is reduced to 0 hit points or is at 0 hit points when it takes this damage, it is disintegrated. When a nonmagical object or magical item of uncommon quality or lower touches the worldbreaker, the worldbreaker can choose to disintegrate the touched object or magical item (no action required).

trait.name: Destructive Ki
entries: The worldbreaker's body overflows with destructive ki, possessing 30 ki points. The worldbreaker can expend ki points (included in the feature's description) to take certain actions. The worldbreaker recovers all of its ki points when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Diamond Soul
entries: When the worldbreaker fails a saving throw, it can expend 4 ki points to succeed instead.

trait.name: Titanic Creature
entries: The worldbreaker is a titanic creature which is so large that combat involves dividing its body up into various sections, each of which has a fixed initiative count on which it acts (losing initiative ties), detailed in its description. Each section is considered a unique creature for purposes of targeting (in case an effect or attack would include multiple targets), and effects that include an area may affect multiple sections of the worldbreaker if the area is large enough. Each section has its own hit points and actions but shares the worldbreaker's other statistics (such as damage resistances, saving throws, etc.). When a section is reduced to 0 hit points, it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it regains hit points or the worldbreaker is slain, which causes the section to die along with the worldbreaker. If a section has a speed, the worldbreaker can move up to that section's speed during the section's turn. Creatures can enter and occupy the same space as the worldbreaker, which is considered difficult terrain, and the worldbreaker cannot make opportunity attacks. Finally, attempts to forcibly move, banish, or magically teleport the worldbreaker or any of its parts automatically fail.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the rakshasa can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Shadow in the Night
entries: The rakshasa is {@condition invisible} when in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The rakshasa deals an extra 35 ({@damage 10d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the rakshasa that isn't incapacitated and the rakshasa doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Tools of Assassination
entries: The rakshasa's weapons are magical and composed of fiendish green steel. The rakshasa has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in the attack) made with its talwar. If the rakshasa starts its turn and is not in possession of its talwar, the weapons magically reappear in its possession.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes two attacks and takes one other action.

action.name: Shadow Step
entries: The rakshasa magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Snuff Light
entries: The rakshasa blows a puff of air at a source of light from an object (such as a torch or lantern) or a magical effect (such as {@spell light}) it can see. The light is snuffed out immediately, and spells or magical effects producing light affected by this feature immediately end.

action.name: Talwar
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) slashing damage. If the attack scores a critical hit, double the damage of the attack.

reaction.name: Deceptive Magic Immunity
entries: When the rakshasa is affected by a spell or magical effect, it can use its reaction to attempt a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) ability check versus the source's spell save DC. On a success, the rakshasa is unaffected and a creature of the rakshasa's choice that it can see is affected instead.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: The rakshasa has three extra reactions.

trait.name: Tools of Slaughter
entries: The rakshasa's weapons are magical and composed of fiendish green steel. The rakshasa has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in the attack) made with its greatswords. The blades vanish if held by a creature other than the rakshasa and reappear in the rakshasa's possession at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes four attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a non-evil creature, it takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Whirlwind Attack {@recharge 5}
entries: The rakshasa begins spinning at high speed until the end of its turn, gaining the following benefits.

items: The rakshasa's speed is doubled.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of a creature for the first time on a turn, it makes two greatsword attacks against that creature.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of an object or structure for the first time on a turn, it deals 50 points of slashing damage to it.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of a spell or magical effect of 7th level or lower that would obstruct or prevent its movement, the effect immediately ends.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that the rakshasa can see hits it with an attack, it can use its reaction to halve the attack's damage against it.

reaction.name: Warrior's Magic Immunity
entries: When the rakshasa is targeted by a spell or magical effect, it can use its reaction to attempt to parry it. To do so, the rakshasa makes a Greatsword attack. If the attack roll is greater than or equal to the source of the targeting spell or magical effect's save DC, the spell or magical effect is parried and instead targets the source of the spell or magical effect.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Blightcaller
entries: When the rakshasa effects an area with a spell or magical effect, the ground in that area becomes corrupted. When a non-evil creature on the blighted ground attempts an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, it rolls a {@dice d8} and subtracts the number rolled from the result. Any corruption caused by this effect fades 1 month after the rakshasa leaves the locale.

trait.name: Natural Spell Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 8th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. If it chooses to be affected by a spell cast by an enemy creature, it gains a spell slot of that spell's level or lower, up to its spell slot maximum.

trait.name: Subsume Magic
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the rakshasa can choose to expend a single spell slot of 1st level or higher. When it does so, the rakshasa regains {@dice 1d8} hit points plus an additional {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot expended.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa casts up to three spells: a spell of 1st level or higher and two cantrips.

action.name: Earth Reaver {@recharge}
entries: The rakshasa strikes the ground with its fist, causing a tremendous magical explosion in a 300-foot radius centered on it. Creatures standing on the ground in the area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 78 ({@damage 12d12}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success. Objects and structures in the area take double damage from this effect.

trait.name: Aura of Purity
entries: The chastity is surrounded by an aura of pure goodness in a 60-foot radius. At the start of each of the chastity's turns, each enemy creature in the area must make a Charisma ability check (no associated skill) to demonstrate its purity of spirit, the DC of which is equal to the creature's CR or character level (whichever is higher). On a failure, the creature is considered impure, gaining the following penalties against the chastity and its allies until the start of the chastity's next turn.
The creature deals half damage.
The creature has disadvantage on saving throws.
The creature feels great shame for its actions.

trait.name: Bastion of Faith
entries: When the chastity takes the {@action Dodge} action, it gains a +5 bonus to its AC for as long as it is benefitting from the {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: Divine Conviction
entries: The chastity cannot be forced or compelled to act in a manner that goes against its morality.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chastity's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Dedication
entries: The chastity prays for success. Until the end of its next turn, the next time the chastity forces a creature to attempt a saving throw, that creature cannot succeed on that saving throw.

action.name: Faithful Strike
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 31 ({@damage 7d8}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Grace in Failure
entries: When the humility fails a saving throw or is critically hit, it regains 30 hit points.

trait.name: Humble before Grace
entries: When the humility deals damage to a creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone} in shame for 1 minute. A creature must remain {@condition prone} for the entire duration and immediately falls {@condition prone} if forced to its feet by outside influence. An affected creature can attempt a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Prison of Humility
entries: When the humility reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it instead reduces it to 1 hit point and magically teleports the creature onto the miniature landscape that makes up its nucleus. The creature is shrunk down to proportions appropriate for the landscape in the process. An affected creature cannot escape the nucleus by any means nor can it be restored to its original size by any power short of a {@spell wish} spell. This effect only ends if the humility is slain or the creature attains true humility and graciousness (at the humility's discretion).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The humility makes four attacks, or two attacks and one other action.

action.name: Holy Lightning
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Pride Comes before the Fall {@recharge}
entries: The humility unleashes a wave of divine energy in a 300-foot radius. Each enemy creature in that area with current hit points greater than the humility's current hit points must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or have their current hit points reduced to the humility's current hit points.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The humility magically teleports up to 500 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When the humility appears in the space, it emits a flash of radiant light in a 30-foot radius. Enemy creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage, or half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Cloud Cover
entries: As a bonus action, the diligence surrounds itself with thick clouds that completely fill a 30-foot-radius sphere. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured for creatures other than the diligence and its allies. The cloud does not move with the diligence, but the diligence can re-center the cloud on itself as a bonus action. The cloud lasts until the diligence dismisses it with another bonus action or it creates a second cloud using this feature.

trait.name: Find the Center
entries: On each of its turns, if the diligence does not move from its space or take any actions other than its Heavenly Snipe attack, it deals an additional 90 ({@damage 20d8}) radiant damage on a successful hit with that attack.

trait.name: Penetrating Shots
entries: When the diligence makes a successful ranged weapon attack and exceeds the target's AC by 10 or more, the projectile pierces through the target and continues onward in a straight line away from the diligence. If the projectile encounters another creature or object along its path, that creature or object becomes a target of the attack as well (as though the diligence had made the original attack against it). If the projectile encounters a magical effect or spell that would stop it, the projectile is destroyed and the spell or magical effect ends.

trait.name: Unerring Precision
entries: The diligence's weapon attacks are magical. Additionally, the diligence has advantage on ranged attacks and its ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Virtuous Vigilance
entries: The diligence has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against creatures with a lower Wisdom score than it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The diligence makes four Star Shot attacks, or it makes two Star Shot attacks and takes the {@action Ready} action to ready a Heavenly Snipe to use against the first enemy that moves that it can see.

action.name: Dispersion
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the diligence expands the radius of its Cloud Cover feature to 120 feet. Additionally, the diligence immediately magically teleports to an unoccupied space within the affected area.

action.name: Heavenly Snipe
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}65 ({@damage 10d10 + 10}) piercing damage and 55 ({@damage 10d10}) force damage.

action.name: Star Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 500 ft., one target. {@h}43 ({@damage 6d10 + 10}) damage.

trait.name: Fiendish Slaves
entries: When the utterance casts a spell, it can choose to treat any fiend allies that it can see as the point of origin for that spell.

Additionally, attacks made by allied fiends that can see the utterance benefit from spells and magical effects that the utterance is also benefiting from (such as {@spell hex} or {@spell foresight} spells).

trait.name: Roar of Power
entries: The utterance is incapable of speaking at any volume lower than a shout and is immune to any effect that would prevent it from speaking.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The utterance is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The utterance has the following spells prepared.

1: {@spell wish} (can only cast to grant the wishes of humanoids who are under the effects of a {@spell geas} spell cast by the utterance)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Manifest Fiend and then uses either Crashing Yell or casts a spell.

action.name: Crashing Yell {@recharge 4}
entries: The utterance lets loose a thunderous shout. All creatures within 10 feet of the utterance must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) thunder damage and be pushed 20 feet away from the utterance and knocked {@condition prone}. A successful saving throw halves the damage and prevents both being pushed and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hellfire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) fire damage. If the target has resistance to fire damage, it instead does not have resistance to fire damage from this attack.

action.name: In Times of Need (1/Short Rest)
entries: The utterance uses Manifest Fiend four times.

action.name: Manifest Fiend
entries: The utterance magically manifests a being of truespeech that resembles an {@creature imp|MM} or {@creature quasit|MM}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the utterance. Fiends created in this manner act on the utterance's turn and can take an action to make a Hellfire Bolt attack as though the utterance had made the attack (using the utterance's bonus to hit). The utterance can have a maximum of four fiends created in this manner; they vanish 1 hour after their creation or until the utterance is slain, whichever comes first. The creature is considered a native denizen of the plane on which it was manifested.

trait.name: Blood Armor
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the utterance can lose 5 hit points to magically shroud itself in armor made of blood, increasing its AC to 21 until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Bloodsight
entries: The utterance automatically succeeds on {@skill Perception} checks to detect flesh-and-blood creatures.

trait.name: Crimson Craft
entries: When the utterance gains temporary hit points and already has temporary hit points, the new temporary hit points are added to its temporary hit points instead of replacing them. The utterance can have a number of temporary hit points equal to its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Blood Plague, then uses either Mirror Vitae or Life Transference.

action.name: Blood Plague
entries: A flesh-and-blood creature the utterance can see within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or contract a virulent disease. On a failure, wounds immediately open along the creature's skin and it loses 28 ({@dice 8d6}) hit points.

Additionally, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while infected. At the start of each of its turns the creature can choose to attempt a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, curing the disease on a success. On a failure, the creature loses 28 ({@dice 8d6}) hit points.

action.name: Life Transference
entries: The utterance of blood loses a number of temporary hit points, and a single flesh-and-blood creature the utterance can see gains an equal number of temporary hit points. Temporary hit points gained from this feature are lost when the creature finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Mirror Vitae
entries: The utterance chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or its blood is linked to the utterance's. While linked, when the utterance takes damage, it instead takes half damage (rounded down) and target takes the remaining damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the link on a success.

reaction.name: Harvest Life
entries: When a flesh-and-blood creature other than the utterance within 60 feet takes damage or loses hit points, the utterance can take a reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt or hit points lost. Temporary hit points gained by this feature are lost when the utterance finishes a short or long rest.

monster.name: Utterance of Erudition
languages: all with Book of Truth; otherwise

trait.name: Book of Truth
entries: The utterance carries with it a book of its research into truespeech. While the utterance is in possession of this book, it has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. Additionally, it can speak all languages and knows if it hears a lie. If the utterance loses this book, it can no longer use its Consult the Book or In Defense of Self abilities.

bonus.name: In Defense of Self
entries: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the utterance can cast one of the following spells at will, requiring only verbal components: {@spell dimension door}, {@spell dispel magic} (5th level), {@spell true seeing}. The utterance's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Consult the Book or Speak the Word, then makes two Ray of Truth attacks.

action.name: Consult the Book
entries: The utterance chooses a creature it can see within 120 feet. The utterance learns the following information about the target: current hit points, hit point maximum, and saving throw proficiencies.

action.name: Ray of Truth
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) radiant damage.

action.name: Speak the Word
entries: The utterance targets a creature it can see within 120 feet and magically causes one of the following effects.

items: {@i Despair (At Will).} The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute. During this time the creature can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

{@i Discord (At Will).} The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or fall to bickering and arguing with everyone around it for 1 minute. During this time, it is incapable of meaningful communication and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

{@i Heal (1/Short Rest).} The target regains all its hit points. If the target is {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition stunned}, the condition ends. If the target is {@condition prone}, it can immediately take a reaction to stand up.
{@i Kill (1/Long Rest).} If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, this has no effect.

{@i Stun (2/Short Rest).} If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is {@condition stunned}. Otherwise, this has no effect. An affected target may attempt a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Superior Linguistics
entries: When a creature the utterance can hear within 120 feet casts a spell with a range other than touch or self, the utterance can use its reaction to choose the spell's target area or creatures. The utterance must be able to see any targets it wishes to affect in this manner.

trait.name: Powerful Words
entries: Spells and magical effects cannot prevent the utterance from speaking. Additionally, its words can always be heard and understood by those within earshot (even {@condition deafened} creatures).

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The utterance has two reactions.

trait.name: Words of Entropy
entries: At the start of each of the utterance's turns it can choose to immediately end a single effect or spell it can see with a duration greater than instantaneous.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Truename Research or Subjugate, then uses Truename Disruption twice against two different targets.

action.name: Subjugate
entries: The utterance commands a creature who can hear it to follow a course of activity (limited to one sentence) and force it to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must follow the command, taking all actions and spending movement necessary to best fulfill its terms. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until the target fulfills the command, whichever comes first. If an affected target takes damage it can immediately attempt a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Terminate
entries: The utterance deletes the truename of a creature it can see whose truename it knows. At the end of the target's next turn, it dies and its body disappears into nothingness. The target cannot be restored to life without its truename, or until a new truename is given to it.

action.name: Truename Disruption
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) psychic damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Truename Research
entries: The utterance attempts to discern the truename of a creature it can see within 120 feet by making a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by the target's Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. On a success, the utterance learns a fragment of the target's truename. While the utterance knows this fragment, it has advantage on all attacks, ability checks, and saving throws against the target.
Additionally, if the target is {@condition incapacitated}, the utterance can spend the next hour engaged in strenuous activity to discern the target's full truename.

reaction.name: Censure
entries: As a reaction when a creature that can hear the utterance within 120 feet takes a reaction or bonus action, it can force that creature instead take no action.

reaction.name: Rebuke
entries: As a reaction when a creature that can hear the utterance moves within 15 feet of it, the utterance can force the creature to succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and be magically teleported to an unoccupied space the utterance can see within 60 feet.

monster.name: Shield Maiden
languages: but can only be understood by the dead and other valkyries

trait.name: Holy Armaments
entries: The maiden's weapon attacks are magical, and the maiden cannot be disarmed of her weapons or equipment. When the maiden hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant or necrotic damage (maiden's choice, included in the attack).

trait.name: Tower Shield Mastery
entries: While the maiden is not {@condition incapacitated} and wielding her shield, she has total cover against ranged attacks.

trait.name: Zeal of the Worthy
entries: While the shield maiden is not {@condition incapacitated}, humanoid creatures of her choice within 30 ft. of her cannot be reduced below 1 hit point unless the maiden chooses otherwise.

bonus.name: Rune of Warding
entries: The maiden's shield is inscribed with a powerful magical rune. As a bonus action on each of her turns, the maiden can empower the rune to gain one of the following benefits for 1 minute. This effect ends prematurely if the maiden uses this feature again.

items.name: Rune of Armor
items.entry: The maiden takes half damage from weapon attacks.

items.name: Rune of Magic
items.entry: The maiden takes half damage from spells.

items.name: Rune of Empowerment
items.entry: When the maiden attempts a saving throw or ability check, she rolls a {@dice d6} and adds the amount rolled to the result.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes a spear and shield bash attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing plus 11 ({@dice 2d10}) radiant or necrotic (her choice).

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning plus 11 ({@dice 2d10}) radiant or necrotic (her choice). If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition unconscious} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The maiden pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life. If the creature's soul is willing, it is restored to life at its maximum hit points and regains all its features as though it had finished a long rest. After 24 hours, the creature dies and cannot be restored to life for a period of 10 years.

action.name: Star Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 500 ft., one target. {@h}43 ({@damage 6d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Wyrd Seer
languages: but can only be understood by the dead or other valkyries

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The seer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The seer pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life. If the creature's soul is willing, it is restored to life at its maximum hit points and regains all its features as though it had finished a long rest. After 24 hours, the creature dies and cannot be restored to life for a period of 10 years.

trait.name: Trial of the Valkyries
entries: The seer emits an aura of psychic energy in a 60 ft. radius centered on it. When an enemy creature in the area deals damage to the seer, it takes psychic damage equal to the damage dealt. If this damage reduces a creature to zero hit points, it cannot willingly harm the seer again for the rest of its life.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The seer's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (Spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

action.name: Soul Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one living creature. {@h}35 ({@damage 6d8 + 8}) radiant or necrotic damage, and the seer regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

reaction.name: Twist of Fate
entries: When a creature within 60 ft. of the seer attempts an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, the seer instead chooses whether the creature succeeds or fails, regardless of the result.

trait.name: Deadly Charger (1/turn)
entries: When the pegasus spends movement and moves in a straight line for at least 60 ft. and either it or its rider makes a melee attack immediately at the end of that movement, the attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage for every 10 ft. traveled in the line.

trait.name: Loyalty
entries: The pegasus cannot be compelled to act in a manner that goes against the interests of its rider. Additionally, when the pegasus rolls initiative and is being ridden, it can choose to have its turn occur simultaneously to its rider.

trait.name: Soulbound
entries: While ridden, the pegasus cannot be slain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pegasus makes two hooves attacks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., four different targets. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Planeshift (1/Short Rest)
entries: The pegasus casts the spell {@spell plane shift}. Willing creatures wishing to journey with the pegasus must be riding it, insead of linking hands.

monster.name: Brynhildr War Queen
languages: but can only be understood by the dead or other valkyries

trait.name: Adamantine Skin
entries: If the war queen takes 15 or less damage from an attack, it instead takes no damage.

trait.name: Duel of the Fates
entries: When the queen rolls initiative, it can choose to be magically transported to an unoccupied space on its personal battleground; a mystical demiplane of war and battle. When it does so, each creature within 300 ft. of the war queen can choose to accompany it, appearing in an unoccupied space of the war queen's choice on the demiplane.

This demiplane is an open battlefield approximately 300 ft. in diameter, with no cover or terrain features to speak of. The war queen cannot leave the demiplane while an enemy creature of the demiplane lives, neither can enemy creatures leave the demiplane while the war queen lives. When a creature first arrives on the demiplane, all spells and magical effects currently affecting it end, and it is restored to its hit point maximum.

If an effect would prevent this feature from occurring when the war queen rolls initiative, it instead immediately occurs at the start of each of the war queen's turns, until it takes effect, or the war queen is slain.

trait.name: Holy Armaments
entries: The war queen's weapon attacks are magical, and the queen cannot be disarmed of her weapons or equipment. When the war queen hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant or necrotic damage (queen's choice, included in the attack).

trait.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The war queen pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life.
